### Description
Sometimes [processData(final NodeId nodeId, final RpcStream rpcStream, final ByteBuf data)](https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/blob/0e50d2ec0a3bcc2d815284c65167c59f3f9f3c3e/networking/eth2/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/networking/eth2/rpc/core/Eth2OutgoingRequestHandler.java#L125) in response handler is called before the handler's is state prepared in [handleInitialPayloadSent(final RpcStream stream)](https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/blob/0e50d2ec0a3bcc2d815284c65167c59f3f9f3c3e/networking/eth2/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/networking/eth2/rpc/core/Eth2OutgoingRequestHandler.java#L102). So data arrives but we haven't toggled the state yet. 

I'm pretty stuck in solving this:
- we couldn't synchronize flushing the data sent and changing the state
- handler runs in one thread, if I try to poll state with delay, it blocks state changing too

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
We get this kind of errors while running `BeaconBlocksByRangeIntegrationTest` and similar tests. Not sure how often we could catch it in production
